posts.name: Anton Kratz
posts.cooked:
Subject explains my question. Can I bulk-export or bulk-download an entire chat (text, photos) as plain text (the photos obviously wouldn‚Äôt be plaintext but PNG or some sane format)?

Is that possible? I use both the iOS app as well as the macOS desktop app.

posts.name: Anton Kratz
posts.cooked: Anyone? I would like to export a chat to plain text, is that possible, if yes, how?
No this is not possible. See the thread about iOS backup
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.name: Anton Kratz
posts.cooked: Thanks. I read that thread, sadly it conflates backups with ASCII export which are related but different things, and the thread is full of the usual ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt like it why don‚Äôt you change the source code‚Äù bs, but anyway this is preposterous. Signal is a silo. Once text is in, there‚Äôs no way out. I have tons of notes which I took, especially in the ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù thread where you can send messages to yourself. I liked Signal and was ‚Äúevangelizing‚Äù it to friends, family but this is just like a bad joke. No ASCII export hahaha thanks.

There is nothing built in. You could potentially use a SQLCipher database tool to access your messages from the Signal Desktop database and export them that way, but it would be a bit of work.

The whole point of Signal is privacy and security. When you export the messages to somewhere else as plain text, you lose any protection provided by Signal.

posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked:
akratz:

ASCII export

Could you please stop repeating ‚ÄúASCII‚Äù? I‚Äôm pretty sure that you have messages that contain non-ASCII characters. What this hypothetical export feature is supposed to do with them?

As far as I understand, you are just asking for ‚Äúplain text message export‚Äù.

posts.name: Jeff Stern
posts.cooked:
The whole point of Signal is privacy and security. When you export the messages to somewhere else as plain text, you lose any protection provided by Signal.

Exactly. Which is why when I export, I‚Äôll be doing something OUTSIDE of Signal, and Signal doesn‚Äôt have to take any responsibility any more for what is done with that text: I DO.
On Android you can use the client by johanw666

posts.name: Jeff Stern
posts.cooked:
@Leptopoda thank you. I Googled, and found GitHub - johanw666/Signal-Android: Fork from a private messenger for Android with extra options added: full backup and (partial, ony text) xml backup of messages. Restore can happen at any time, not only after a fresh install. Import SMS database. Import of (unencrypted) WhatsApp databases. Removed apk expire. Choose between passphrase protection and the Android screenlock. Choice for the backup location (internal or removable storage on Android < 11 (on 11 and higher this is already possible)). Set the maptype in the place picker. Option to treat view-once media as normal media. Option to ignore remote deletion. Choose between FCM or websocket notification delivery.

I assume that is the one you are talking about? It appears to be the (or ‚Äúa‚Äù) beta branch/fork for official Signal? Excellent. I‚Äôm glad to be a beta tester, and clicked on the ‚ÄúJoining the Beta‚Äù link on that page, and clicked through to subscribe to the beta testing program for Signal via Google Play.

Curious: Anyone know if there is a similar feature being tested for the Desktop app?

Or are the codebases the same, actually?

link_counts.title: GitHub - johanw666/Signal-Android: Fork from a private messenger for Android with full backup and (partial, ony text) xml backup of messages. Restore can happen at any time, not only after a fresh install. Added passphrase protection in addition to the An

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
androclus:

and clicked on the ‚ÄúJoining the Beta‚Äù link on that page, and clicked through to subscribe to the beta testing program for Signal via Google Play.

That will give you the official Signal, not my fork. I didn‚Äôt change the readme from the original. My fork is not in Google Play (would be impossible for an app with the same application id of another one anyway), you can click on releases and download the apk.

Because it is not signed with an official Signal signing key you can not nornmally install it on top of the official Signal. You would need either some root tricks (Lucky Patcher or Xposed + Xinstaller), or make a backup, remove Signal, install the fork and restore the backup.

posts.name: Jeff Stern
posts.cooked:
@johanw666 Thank you for the clarification.

I am new here. Has there been any discussion here of pulling in the part of your fork that has the chat export as text (XML or otherwise), into the official Signal?

Or is this experimentation on your part that the official Signal will likely never have?

My intent is not to start a war here (if this has been a touchy subject in the past), only to bring myself up-to-date with what the chances are of inclusion of this feature. Thx

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
androclus:

Has there been any discussion here of pulling in the part of your fork that has the chat export as text (XML or otherwise), into the official Signal?

Or is this experimentation on your part that the official Signal will likely never have?

Actually, the code I have used to be in Signal but was removed. I put it back in and maintained it (some minor changes had to be made in the xml import when the Signal code was prepared for non-phone number user id‚Äôs). Same for the full data export (still called encrypted backup), but there larger changes had to be made after the switch to sqlcipher and the Android keystore.

releases

It would be useful to be able to export a chat in order to backup all images of the chat. I convinced everyone to migrate from Whatsapp to Signal but now I feel a bit stupid to not be able to access our family collection of photos outside of the app. (sadly) I am even consirering going back to Whatsapp‚Ä¶

I am not technical but I will try johanw666‚Äôs fork on an android.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
Cloud backups are coming. They‚Äôve been working on it for several years and recent commits seem to indicate they‚Äôre very close to a beta release. See recent messages in the feature request topic for a list of commits.

Encrypted cloud backups Feature Requests
This would be great feature that can be implement with schedule backup. ex: backup every 30/60/90/180/etc and keep the most X number of backups. this way we can restore if ever needed

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Barthelemy_Massot:

I am not technical but I will try johanw666‚Äôs fork on an android.

My fork has extra backup options but not per conversation, and for human readable backups only text in xml format. You can take a conventional bckup and see if this too can extract what you want: Releases ¬∑ bepaald/signalbackup-tools ¬∑ GitHub

anon53652:

You can take a conventional bckup and see if this too can extract what you want: Releases ¬∑ bepaald/signalbackup-tools ¬∑ GitHub

That tool has an HTML export option that might work for you.
